CPC-specific-text.text: metal hydrides, monoborane, diborane or addition complexes thereof C01B6/00

reference.text: ; salts of oxyacids of halogens C01B11/00; peroxides, salts of peroxyacids C01B15/00; thiosulfates, dithionites, polythionates C01B17/64; compounds containing selenium or tellurium C01B19/00; azides C01B21/08;

CPC-specific-text.text: compounds other than ammonia or cyanogen, containing nitrogen, non-metals and optionally metals C01B21/082

reference.text: ; metal imides or amides C01B21/092; nitrites C01B21/50;
; phosphides C01B25/08; salts of oxyacids of phosphorus C01B25/16; compounds containing silicon C01B33/00; compounds containing boron C01B35/00

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: C01C3/08, C01C3/14, C01C3/16, C01C3/20 take precedence

note.note-paragraph: Complex ammine salts, e.g. [Pd(NH3)4]Cl2, are also classified in the relevant groups of subclasses C01D - C01G, according to the metal

CPC-specific-text.text: making use of solid ammonia storage materials, e.g. complex ammine salts
Preparation of aqueous ammonia solutions, i.e. ammonia water
Preparation of ammonia from inorganic compounds

reference.text: preparation or purification of gas mixtures for ammonia synthesis

CPC-specific-text.text: from N2 and H2 in presence of a catalyst
characterised by the synthesis reactor, e.g. arrangement of catalyst beds and heat exchangers in the reactor

reference.text: arrangement of several reactors C01C1/0405; fixed-bed reactors in general B01J8/02

CPC-specific-text.text: Reactors with the catalyst arranged in tubes
by absorption in liquids, e.g. water
Purge gas treatment, e.g. for removal of inert gases or recovery of H2
Process control; Start-up or cooling-down procedures
Processes integrated with preparations of other compounds, e.g. methanol, urea or with processes for power generation

title-part.text: Preparation of ammonia from nitrogenous organic substances

reference.text: treatment of molasses in general C13B50/006

title-part.text: Separation of ammonia from ammonia liquors, e.g. gas liquors

reference.text: as part of the ammonia synthesis process C01C1/04

title-part.text: Separation of ammonia from gases and vapours

reference.text: as part of the ammonia synthesis process C01C1/04

title-part.text: Preparation from ammonia and sulfuric acid or sulfur trioxide
Preparation by double decomposition of ammonium salts with sulfates
Preparation from compounds containing nitrogen and sulfur
Preventing coalescing or controlling form or size of the crystals
Methods of preparing ammonium salts in general

note.note-paragraph: This group does not cover ammonium salts of complex acids (other than complex cyanides) containing a metal in the anion, which are covered by the relevant groups of subclasses C01D - C01G, according to the metal.
Salts of polybasic acids with ammonium and a metal as cations are classified as though the ammonium were hydrogen.

CPC-specific-text.text: Preparation by decomposing nitrogen-containing organic compounds, e.g. molasse waste or urea

reference.text: by distillation of carbamates C01C3/02, C01C3/08, C01C3/14, C01C3/16; by decomposing formamide or ammonium formate C01C3/0204

CPC-specific-text.text: Synthesis of metal cyanides or metal cyanamides from elementary nitrogen and carbides
from formamide or from ammonium formate
from hydrocarbons and ammonia in the presence of oxygen, e.g. the Andrussow-process
from hydrocarbons and ammonia in the absence of oxygen, e.g. HMA-process
making use of fluidised beds, e.g. the Shawinigan-process
from simple alkali or alkaline earth metal cyanides
from simple or complex cyanides of the noble metals
from simple or complex cyanides of other transition metals, e.g. from iron cyanides
from simple or complex cyanides of other metals

title-part.text: Simple or complex cyanides of metals
